pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.2: At that time Venerable Udāyī was associating with and visiting a number of families in Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.3: One of those families had given their daughter in marriage to the son of another family.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.4: Just then, after robing up in the morning, Venerable Udāyī took his bowl and robe and went to the first of those families.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.17: At that time Visākhā Migāramātā had many healthy children and grandchildren, and she was considered very auspicious.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.18: At sacrifices, festivals, and celebrations people would feed Visākhā first.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.19: Just then she had been invited to the family that supported Venerable Udāyī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.23: Although you may not be aiming at that act, people with little confidence are hard to convince.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.25: After leaving, Visākhā told the monks about what had happened.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.28: “How can Venerable Udāyī sit alone with a woman on a private and concealed seat suitable for doing it?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.29: After rebuking Udāyī in many ways, they told the Master …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.30: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you sat alone with a woman on a private and concealed seat suitable for doing it?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.33: Foolish man, how can you sit alone with a woman on a such a seat?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.34: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.35: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.36: ‘If a monk sits alone with a woman on a private and concealed seat suitable for doing it, and a trustworthy female lay follower sees him and accuses him
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.37: of an offense entailing expulsion or an offense entailing suspension or an offense entailing confession, then, if he admits to the sitting, he is to be dealt with
pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:1.38: according to one of these three or according to what that trustworthy female lay follower has said.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ay1:3.1: If he admits to going, and he admits to sitting, and he admits to an offense, he is to be dealt with for the offense.
